alert.note: Alert for Greene; Hale (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 3:10PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Tuscaloosa, east central Greene and north central Hale Counties through 345 PM CDT... At 309 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Knoxville, or 13 miles northeast of Eutaw. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Moundville, Knoxville, Elliots Creek, Mound State Park, Moundville Airport and Ralph. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for west central Alabama.
